castaways.name: castaways
castaways.description:
You are castaways on a deserted island. It’s the end of summer, and
          you must prepare for the coming winter — build a shelter, a roof, and a palisade.
          It will be hard to survive the difficult months of autumn and winter ahead. You
          will also need a pile of wood that you can set on fire, hoping that some ship 
          passing on the horizon will notice you.
castaways.objective:
To win, players must create the Fire item and build the wood pile 
          shown on the scenario card. If these conditions are met in the 10th, 11th, 12th
          round, the players win.
castaways.mechanics:
The pile consists of 15 wood tokens. Players can place wood on the
          pile before the Action phase. In one round, any amount of wood can be placed on
          the pile, but no more than one building stage of the pile can be completed. (At
          first, 1 wood token, then a maximum of 2 tokens, and so on.) Wood placed on the
          pile cannot be taken back from it.
castaways.winNarrative:
Despite numerous hardships and difficult conditions on the island,
          you managed to survive. A passing ship spotted your burning woodpile and came to
          rescue you..
castaways.defeatNarrative_missedObjective:
Unfortunately, you failed to build and light the
          woodpile in time. Despite your desperate cries, the passing ship did not notice 
          you. It seems you are stuck here forever.
castaways.defeatNarrative_death:
The conditions on the island proved too dangerous. Your
          efforts to survive were insufficient. Player {{player}} has breathed their last.  
          You will remain forever in the shadow of this cursed island.

grandmas recipe.name: Grandma's Recipe
grandmas recipe.comment: After my grandma's soup, you'll definitely feel better.

hooch.name: Hooch
hooch.description:
Discard 3 $determination$ to remove 1 $rain-cloud$ or convert 1
          $snow-cloud$ into 1 $rain-cloud$.
hooch.comment:
I know it's cold and all, but I've got something to warm your body and
          clear your mind.

scrounger.name: Scrounger
scrounger.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to $reroll$ any gather die during your
          Action.
scrounger.comment: When I say we'll find it, we will. You just have to know where to look!

stone soup.name: Stone Soup
stone soup.comment:
No ingredients? No problem, just a challenge. A good cook can handle
          anything!

lucky.name: Lucky
lucky.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to $reroll$ any green die during your
          Action.
lucky.comment: Looks like luck is on my side today!

Reconnaissance.name: Reconnaissance
Reconnaissance.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to draw 3 Island tiles from the stack,
          choose 1 and place it on top of the stack.

motivational speech.name: Motivational Speech
motivational speech.comment: Don't worry! I've been through worse and came out unscathed.

scouting.name: Scouting
scouting.description: Discard 3 $determination$ to draw 2 $discovery$ cards and choose 1.
scouting.comment: That's interesting. I'll take a closer look.

economical construction.name: Economical Construction
economical construction.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to use 1 less $wood$ during one of your
          Actions of any type.
economical construction.comment: Not enough materials? What are you talking about? We've got plenty!

craftsmanship.name: Craftsmanship
craftsmanship.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to $reroll$ any brown die during your
          Action.
craftsmanship.comment: I could do this with my eyes closed.

a new idea.name: A New Idea
a new idea.description: Discard 3 $determination$ to draw 5 Idea cards and choose 1.
a new idea.comment: I think I know how to improve our camp…

handyman.name: Handyman
handyman.comment: It's pretty simple, will take just a few moments.

tracking.name: Tracking
tracking.description:
Discard 2 $determination$ to look at the top card of the Hunting
          deck and place it back on top or bottom of the deck.
tracking.comment: A tiger just passed by here. A big tiger…

the hunt.name: The Hunt
the hunt.description:
Discard 4 $determination$ to take the top card of the Beast deck and
          place it on top of the Hunting deck without looking at it.

frenzy.name: Frenzy
frenzy.description:
Discard 3 $determination$ to temporarily gain +3 $weapon$ for the
          next fight.
frenzy.comment: Now I'm really furious. I swear, you won't like me like this!

defensive plan.name: Defensive Plan
defensive plan.description:
Discard 3 $determination$ to increase the level of $palisade$ or
          $weapon$ by 1.
defensive plan.comment: And you, cook, secure the left flank…

fridays ability.name: Action Die Reroll
fridays ability.description: Discard 3 $determination$ to reroll any action die.

personalInventionDescription.shortcut:
+1 resource from a chosen tile around the camp
        during production phase

mysteryCard.amulet with portrait of beautiful lady: amulet with portrait of beautiful lady

alerts.not enough materials for action:
Not enough materials to perform this
        action.
alerts.not enough determination for ability:
Not enough determination points
        to use this ability.
alerts.this is prime player action:
Phase change is decided by the
        prime player.
alerts.missing pawn leader: Leader pawn is missing on the main action slot.

Reconnaissance.description: Choose a tile to be placed on top of the deck.

menu.name: name
menu.login request limit reached:
You have entered incorrect password too many times.
        Your account is temporarily locked for {{tryAfter}} minutes.

gameObjective.title: Game Objective
gameObjective.paragraph:
Robinson Crusoe is a cooperative game. Players either win
                  together (if they manage to survive and achieve the goal defined by the
                  Scenario), or lose together (if at least one Character dies or if they
                  fail to meet the Scenario’s objective within the specified number of
                  rounds).

roundProgression.title: Round Progression
roundProgression.paragraph:
The game lasts for several rounds, the number of which is
                 defined on the Scenario card. Each round is divided into phases, which
                 are resolved in the following order:

phaseDescription.event:
During this phase, the top card from the Event deck is
                  drawn and resolved.
phaseDescription.morale:
This phase is resolved only by the First Player, who 
                  discards or gains Determination tokens based on the position on the
                  Morale track.
phaseDescription.production:
Players receive resources from sources located on the
                  Island tile where the players' Camp is situated.
phaseDescription.action:
This is the most important phase of the round, during
                  which players first plan their actions together and then carry them out.
phaseDescription.weather:
Players must face the weather, which is determined
                  by dice rolls and/or Weather tokens.
phaseDescription.night:
During this phase, players must, among other things, feed
                  themselves and will suffer if they do not have Shelter.

eventPage.title: $t(translation:phase.phase)
eventPage.paragraph1: In this phase, an event card is drawn and placed on the threat space.
eventPage.li1: Adventure icon means that during the next action of the type matching the icon's color, an adventure card will be resolved (in this case, exploration).
eventPage.li2: Book icon triggers an effect specific to the scenario (described on the scenario card).
eventPage.li3: Event Effect triggers an effect (usually negative) when the card is drawn.
eventPage.li4: Threat Action is an action that players must perform to remove the card from the threat space.
eventPage.li5: Threat Effect is the effect that will be triggered if the card is pushed off the threat spaces.
eventPage.paragraph2:
If, when drawing an event card, there is already a card on the
            threat space, the new card replaces it, pushing the existing one to the left,
            which in turn pushes any card already on the left space. If the card on the
            left space is pushed out, it disappears and its threat effect is triggered.

section1.title: Morale Phase
section1.paragraph1: In this phase, the morale level is checked. Based on it, determination tokens are either granted to or taken from the first player .
section1.paragraph2: Determination <Icon icon="determination"/> is needed for characters to use their abilities.

ul1.li1: The player discards or receives an amount of determination tokens <Icon icon="determination"/> equal to the morale level.
ul1.li2: If the morale level <Icon icon="morale-arrow"/> is negative, the first player <Icon icon="star"/> loses determination tokens.
ul1.li3: If the player lacks the required tokens to discard, they receive a wound for each missing token according to the unmet requirements rule.
ul1.li4: If morale is 3, the player receives 3 determination tokens <Icon icon="determination"/> and heals 1 wound <Icon icon="heart"/>.

section2.title: Unmet Requirements
section2.paragraph1: If the game requires a player to discard a resource they don’t have, they receive a wound for each missing resource. For example:
section2.li: 2 food resources <Icon icon="food"/> are required from tiles adjacent to the camp, and these resources then become unavailable. If there is only 1 food resource available around the camp, each player receives 1 wound.
section2.paragraph2: In cases where the rule says IF POSSIBLE, players do not receive wounds for missing resources.

section1.paragraph1: This is the most important phase of the game and consists of two stages: Planning and Resolving Actions.

section2.paragraph1: During the Action Planning stage, players do not take individual turns, but instead decide together which Actions they want to perform during the current round. Then, they mark their choices by assigning their pawns to specific Actions.
section2.paragraph2: Pawns represent the activity of a Character on the island, so with two pawns, each player can take up to two actions. However, some Actions require more than one pawn to be successfully carried out.
section2.paragraph3: Each type of Action (except the Threat Action) can be taken multiple times in the same round and by different players.

actionDescription.threat: Threat Action – this action is taken to prevent the effect of a Threat from being triggered, as shown on a specific Event card on the board in the Threat Action field. Completing this Action grants the player the benefits listed on the card (e.g., Determination tokens or other resources).
actionDescription.hunt: Hunting – allows the player to obtain more food and hides, but usually results in receiving Wounds.
actionDescription.build: Building – allows players to build Shelter, Roof, Palisade, or Weapons, and to turn Ideas into Items.
actionDescription.gather: Gathering Resources – allows players to obtain resources available on discovered Island tiles.
actionDescription.explore: Exploration – allows players to discover new parts of the island.
actionDescription.arrange camp: Arranging Camp – allows the player to gain 2 Determination tokens and increase Morale by 1 (in a 4-player game, the player chooses whether to receive Determination tokens or increase Morale).
actionDescription.rest: Resting – allows the player to heal 1 Wound.

section3.paragraph1: To plan an action, drag a pawn onto the action space.
section3.li1: - placing a pawn in this slot means the character performs the given action.
section3.li2: - this is a support slot. Pawns placed here only assist and do not suffer any consequences of the action.

ul1.li1: At the beginning of each round, a new Event card is drawn which contains a specific Threat Action. Players may choose to perform this Action to prevent the Threat effect from taking place later.
ul1.li2: Each Threat Action is a one-time Action available on a specific card. After resolving it, the card is discarded.
ul1.li3: To perform a Threat Action, players must assign the number of pawns shown on the card (1 or 2) and meet certain additional requirements (for example: having food or wood to discard, having a minimum weapon level, etc.).

section1.paragraph1: Possible requirements for performing a Threat Action:

ul2.li2: Performing the Action requires having Weapons at level 1 (or higher). When resolving the Action, the Weapon level is not decreased. If players do not meet the required Weapon level, they cannot take the Action.
ul2.li3: Performing the Action requires possessing (and discarding during resolution) 1 of the specified resources.
ul2.li4: Performing the Action requires possessing the specified crafted Item. The Item is not lost.

ul1.li2: Hunting is only possible if there is a Hunting deck on the board containing at least one Beast card. Each Beast card allows for one hunt.
ul1.li3: You can go hunting even if the Weapon level is 0.
ul1.li4: Hunting always ends in success (unless the hunting character dies from wounds).

ul2.li1: Beast strength – if it is higher than the Weapon level , the player takes damage for each missing level.
ul2.li2: Weapon level reduction – the number by which the Weapon level decreases after the hunt. For each missing level, the player takes damage.
ul2.li3: Obtained food – added to the upcoming resources.
ul2.li4: Obtained hide – added to the upcoming resources.

ul1.li2: When using only 1 pawn, during the resolution of the Action, the player must roll the Building dice to check whether the Action is successful, whether they receive Wounds, or whether an Adventure occurs.
ul1.li3: Assigning 2 pawns to the Action guarantees success, and the player does not have to roll any dice.
ul1.li4: This Action allows you to build a Shelter, Roof, Palisade, or Weapon, or to transform Ideas into Items.

ul1.li1:
Shelter
During the Night phase, it protects from receiving Wounds caused by sleeping under the open sky. A Shelter is required before building a Roof or Palisade. Once built, a Shelter cannot be lost (unless specified by Scenario rules). Note that some Island tiles may provide natural Shelter.
ul1.li2:
Roof
Protects against weather effects during the Weather phase. To build a Roof, a Shelter must already be present – either constructed or provided by a natural Shelter on the Island tile where the Camp is located.
ul1.li3:
Palisade
Protects against Storm effects and other in-game effects (e.g., wild animal attacks). To build a Palisade, a Shelter must already be present – either constructed or provided by a natural Shelter on the Island tile where the Camp is located.
ul1.li4:
Weapon
Primarily used during Hunting. The higher the Weapon level, the lower the chance the player will receive Wounds during a Beast encounter.
ul1.li5:
Items
Crafting some Items usually provides an additional effect that can be very useful to players (e.g., the “Map” provides an extra pawn for Exploration Actions).

section2.paragraph1: When constructing (Shelter, Roof, or Palisade), you can choose which type of resource to use.

ul1.li1: Gathering Resources requires using 1 or 2 pawns.
ul1.li2: When using only 1 pawn, during the resolution of the Action, the player must roll the Gathering dice to determine if the Action is successful, whether they receive Wounds, or whether an Adventure occurs.
ul1.li3: Assigning 2 pawns to the Action guarantees success, and the player does not have to roll any dice.
ul1.li4: During a single Action, a player gathers resources from only one chosen Source. Each Source provides one unit of a resource (this amount may be modified by the effects of certain Items, Adventures, Events, etc.).
ul1.li5: The further a tile is from the Camp, the more pawns the Action on it will require.

ul1.li2: When using only 1 pawn, during the resolution of the Action, the player must roll the Exploration dice to determine whether the Action is successful, whether they receive Wounds, or whether an Adventure occurs.
ul1.li3: The further the tile is from the Camp, the more pawns the Action on it will require.

ul2.li2: Beast – a random Beast card is added to the Hunting deck after a successful exploration.
ul2.li3: Discovery tokens – added to future resources after a successful exploration.
ul2.li4: Natural shelter – having the Camp on this tile works similarly to having a built Shelter, but with important differences.
ul2.li5: Totem – the effect is described on the Scenario card.
ul2.li6: Terrain type – some actions require a discovered tile with a specific type of terrain (e.g., building the "Knife" invention card requires a discovered tile with Mountain terrain).

ul1.li1: Arranging the Camp requires using 1 pawn.
ul1.li2: Arranging the Camp allows the player to gain 2 Determination tokens and increase Morale by 1 level (in a 4-player game, the player must choose one or the other).
ul1.li3: Each player pawn assigned to the Arrange the Camp Action is resolved separately, which means that if a player assigns both their pawns to this Action, they will resolve it twice and therefore gain 4 Determination tokens and increase Morale by 2 levels.

ul1.li2: Resting allows the player to heal 1 Wound.
ul1.li3: Each player pawn assigned to Rest is resolved separately, which means that if a player assigns both of their pawns to Rest, they will resolve it twice and therefore heal 2 Wounds.

section1.paragraph1:
Once you have allocated all your pawns, click the compass icon
      <Icon icon="compass"/>, to proceed to the action resolution phase 
      (in a multiplayer game, all players must indicate readiness).
section1.paragraph2: During the action phase, all gained resources, discovery tokens, and treasure cards are placed in the future resources.
section1.paragraph3: After the action phase, the resources are moved to the owned resources and become available to the players.

section2.title: Rolling Dice
section2.paragraph1: For actions such as exploration, gathering resources, and building, it is possible to assign 1 pawn less. In that case, the player rolls 3 dice, and the success of the action depends on the result of one of them.

ul1.li2: Determination tokens – The action failed. The player receives 2 determination tokens.
ul1.li3: Adventure – The player resolves an adventure card.

section1.paragraph1:
In this phase, players must face the weather conditions
            on the island. Weather is determined by rolling dice. The type of dice 
            rolled in each round is specified on the scenario card.

ul1.li1: During the game, up to 3 types of tokens can be placed in the weather area.
ul1.li2: If a given token is already present in the weather area, nothing happens.

ul2.li3: Storm Token – reduces the palisade level by 1.

section4.title: Clouds
section4.paragraph1: There are two types of clouds on the Rain and Snow dice:

ul1.li1: Count all snow clouds (from dice and tokens). For each snow cloud, discard 1 <Icon icon="wood"/> wood (to stay warm).
ul1.li2:
Count all clouds (from dice and tokens) and compare the total to the roof level.
                <Icon icon="roof"/> The roof level indicates how many clouds it protects against.
ul1.li3:
For each missing level of roof protection, discard 1 
                 <Icon icon="food"/> food and 1 <Icon icon="wood"/> wood (to stay warm).
ul1.li4: For each resource the players cannot discard, each player receives 1 wound.

section6.title: Hungry Animals
section6.paragraph1: The Hungry Animals die shows the following effects affecting players:

ul1.li1: A fight against a beast with strength 3 is resolved. (First player fights, the weapon level does not decrease.)
ul1.li2: The <Icon icon="palisade"/> palisade level decreases by 1.

ul1.li1:
During the Night phase, each player must eat a meal. To do this, 
                1 food must be discarded per player. If the players don't have enough food, 
                they must jointly decide who will go without. Each player who doesn't have 
                food discarded for them receives 2 Wounds.
ul1.li2:
During the Night phase, players may decide to move the Camp to an adjacent tile. 
                This choice affects which resources players will receive in the next round 
                during the Production phase, and which tiles/areas will be adjacent for 
                purposes such as Gathering Resources and Exploration, etc.
ul1.li3:
If players have not built a Shelter (and their Camp is not located on 
                an Island tile with a natural Shelter), each player receives 1 Wound for 
                sleeping under the open sky.
ul1.li4:
If the players do not have non-perishable food or an Item ("Cellar") 
                or Treasure ("Crates" or "Barrel") that allows food storage, all remaining 
                food after the Night phase spoils and is discarded.
ul1.li5: After the Night phase, character abilities are refreshed and can be used again.

prompt.question: Would you like a guided tour of the game interface?

phase.content: This is where the current phase is displayed. Click on $t(other.order) to continue.

phase list.content: Each round consists of 6 phases, which are resolved in the order shown in this list.

morale.title: Morale
morale.content: This panel shows the current level of morale () and the associated amount of gained or lost determination (). It is required to use the character’s abilities.

map.title: Map
map.content:
The island map consists of hexagonal tiles, each representing a different terrain area. Here you can drag pawns to gather resources and/or explore.
  • Zooming in and out – to adjust the map view, use the mouse wheel or the “+” and “−” buttons.
  • Moving the map – to see other parts of the island, hold down the left mouse button and drag the map in the desired direction.

resources.title: Resources
resources.content:
Here you can track the resources belonging to your team. They are divided into 2 categories.
  • Future resources (at the top) – resources you have gained during the current Action Phase but do not yet possess. They become owned resources after all actions are resolved.
  • Owned resources (at the bottom) – these are in your possession and you can use them.

constructions.title: Constructions and Weapon
constructions.content:
To survive on a deserted island, you need to ensure proper shelter and weapons. Building them requires a specific amount of one of the resources shown next to the construction. If you have both types of required resources, you can choose which one to use by clicking on its icon.
  • Shelter () - protects players while sleeping, preventing damage from sleeping outdoors. Only 1 level can be built.
  • Roof () - protects players and resources from weather conditions.
  • Palisade () - protects players from wild animals.
  • Weapon () - used for hunting beasts. The more dangerous the beast, the higher weapon level is needed to survive unscathed.

tour cards.title: Owned Cards
tour cards.content:
There are 3 types of cards here:
  • Invention cards
  • Mystery cards
  • Items
Switch between them by clicking on the tabs.

threat.title: Threat Actions
threat.content:
At the beginning of each round, during the first phase, a new event card is placed here.
Perform the actions associated with them to receive rewards and avoid negative consequences.

arrange rest.title: Camp arranging nad resting
arrange rest.content:
These slots are used for planning rest and camp arranging actions.
  • An unlimited number of pawns can be assigned to each of these actions.
  • Each action always succeeds.

character.title: Character Card
character.content:
This section contains information about your character and side
            characters.

character img.title: Character
character img.content:
This is your character. Within this area, wounds received on specific
            body parts will be displayed.

character expendables.title: Personal resources
character expendables.content:
Your character has resources that can only be used by them.
  • Weapon level () – used during hunting.
  • Determination tokens () – required to use abilities.

character pawns.title: Pawns
character pawns.content:
Pawns are used to plan actions. They represent the time your character
           spends performing a specific task. During the action phase, drag them onto the
           appropriate slots to plan your next moves.

character abilities.title: Abilities
character abilities.content:
Here is the list of your character's abilities.
  • Some abilities can only be used in specific situations.
  • Skills related to dice rerolls are used directly in the action resolve window.

character side characters.title: Side Characters
character side characters.content:
Here are the side characters and their pawns.
  • Every player has access to and control over them.
  • The dog has no health and does not take damage.
  • The dog can only be used as an assistant for hunting or exploration actions.

health.title: Health
health.content:
Here is your character's health.
  • For each damage point received, the health marker moves to the right.
  • If the health marker passes the arrow (), the team's morale decreases by 1.
  • When the marker reaches the end, the character dies and the players lose.

scenario button.title: Scenario card
scenario button.content:
Here is the button that slides out the scenario card.  
            Click it to continue.

scenario.title: Scenario card
scenario.content:
Here you can find information about the course of the game and the
            victory conditions for the scenario.

scenario rounds.title: Weather
scenario rounds.content:
The game consists of up to 12 rounds, with dice placed above them that
            are rolled during the Weather phase. In each round, the outcome of these dice
            rolls will affect the weather conditions you’ll have to face.

scenario info.title: Scenario Description
scenario info.content:
Before starting the game, don’t forget to review the scenario
            information and its mechanics.

weather.content:
Temporary tokens will be placed here and counted during the Weather
            phase.

discovery tokens.content: Discovery tokens gained during map exploration will be placed here.

next phase.content:
This is the main button that controls the flow of the game. Clicking
            it will advance to the next phase.

menu players.content:
This button opens a window with information about other players’
            characters.

menu settings.content: In the settings, you can restart, save, or return the game to the lobby.

menu guide.content: The guide provides a more detailed description of the game rules.

end.content: In the main menu options, you can reset the UI guide.

form.emailDoNotExist:
No account found linked to the provided email address. Please
        check if the address is correct, or create a new account if you don't have one yet.
form.codeSentOnAdress: A message with a reset code was sent to the address:
form.checkSpam: If you don't see the message in your inbox, please check the spam folder.
form.signInNewPassword: You can now sign in with your new password.
form.sendEmailInstructions:
Enter your email address linked to your account, and we will
        send you a password reset link.
form.invalidCode: The entered code is invalid or has expired.
form.incorrectCredentials: The entered email or password is incorrect.
form.emailTaken: This email is already in use.
form.invalidEmail: The provided email address is invalid.
form.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least {{amount}} characters long.

toast.game restarted: Game was restarted by the host
toast.request limit reached: Request limit reached. Try again in {{tryAfter}} seconds.

error.connectError:
There was a problem connecting to the server. Please check your
        internet connection and try again.
error.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.

emailActivation.title: Verify your email
emailActivation.instructions:
A verification link has been sent to your email address. To complete
        the registration process, click the link in the received message. If you don't see
        the email, please check the Spam or Promotions folder.

systemMessages.only present players can join:
Only players present at the game save can
      join the session.
systemMessages.game terminated: The game was terminated by the host.

logMessages.weather token set:
Placed the $t(translation:weatherToken.{{subject1}})
      token on the adventure tile.
logMessages.action got token:
Placed the $t(translation:tokens.{{subject1}}) token on
      the $t(translation:action.{{subject2}}) tile.
logMessages.action lost token:
Removed the $t(translation:tokens.{{subject1}}) token
      from the $t(translation:action.{{subject2}}) tile.
logMessages.beast moved to bottom of deck: Beast moved to the bottom of the deck.
logMessages.beast shuffled into event deck: Shuffled the beast into the event deck.
logMessages.resource boost removed:
Source of $t(translation:resource.{{subject1}})
      no longer provides extra resource.
logMessages.resource boost added:
Source of $t(translation:resource.{{subject1}} 
      will provide extra resource.
logMessages.character lost wound:
$t(translation:character.{{subject1}}) no longer
    suffers from a wound on $t(translation:resource.{{subject1}}).
logMessages.new prime player: Player {{subject1}} is now the prime player.
